title: Stolen Happy Valley WRX found with new paint
text:
A black coat of paint has not been enough to fool police as they searched for a car stolen during a test drive in Hope Valley.

A five-year-old child was in the back seat of the car when the car was stolen on September 30.

The child’s father had put the blue Subaru WRX up for online for $11,000.

media_camera Pictures of a Subaru WRX stolen by a man and a woman from a Hope Valley home. The owner's 5-year-old son was in the car when the suspects drove off.

A couple approached the owner for a test drive and the female driver took the car for a spin around the block with the owner and his five-year-old son in the back seat.

As the seller got out the car and the man and woman changed positions, the car took off with the man behind wheel and the son still in the back seat.

Police have found the stolen Subaru but unfortunately it has been spray painted black and severely damaged. A 35yo man has been arrested and charged with unlawful possession as detectives continue the search for the original thieves. @9NewsAdel pic.twitter.com/KB7l8FOTX2 — Keziah Sullivan (@9keziahsullivan) October 9, 2019

The seller gave chase, jumping in a different car.

He found his son standing on the side of the road 300m away. He was not harmed.

Police located the car on Tuesday on Stebonheath Rd in Smithfield Plains where it had been spray painted black.

A 35-year-old Campbelltown man was arrested and charged with unlawful possession.

He was bailed and will face court again in November.

Detectives are still investigating the theft of the car.

Anyone with any information is asked to contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000 or by going online.
description: A car stolen in a test drive with the owners child in the back has been recovered. The child was found unharmed after the theft but the butchered vehicle has seen better days.
